intro: Chaetogastra saturejoides, commonly known as the Indian bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is native to regions of Asia, including India, China, and Southeast Asia, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has slender, creeping stems with opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its small, pink or white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the spring. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
